**Analyzing Crawler Strategy**

I've just finished reviewing the document detailing the content crawler strategy. The core plan revolves around scraping workflows from n8n.io and storing them locally as JSON files. The strategy, specifically Option B, aims to place these files within the `src/` directory. My focus is now on the data source and storage implications.


**Examining Data Integration**

I'm now diving into the workflow data integration. I'm focusing on how the scraped JSON data will mesh with the current system. I'm updating `src/lib/services/workflows.ts` to use real data. Also, I'm analyzing the data schema, verifying consistency with `src/lib/types/workflow.ts`, and checking if mock data is suitable for `src/data/mock-workflows.ts`. Finally, I'll analyze the page implementation in `src/pages/workflows/[slug].astro`.

  1 | /**
  2 |  * å·¥ä½œæµæ•°æ®æœåŠ¡
  3 |  * æä¾›å·¥ä½œæµæ•°æ®çš„è·å–å’ŒæŸ¥è¯¢åŠŸèƒ½
  4 |  */
  5 | 
  6 | import type { Workflow, LoadMoreParams } from '../types/workflow';
  7 | import { supabase, isSupabaseConfigured, handleSupabaseError, withRetry } from './supabase';
  8 | import { getAllMockWorkflows, getMockWorkflowBySlug, getMockWorkflowById } from '../../data/mock-workflows';
  9 | import { mockWorkflowDetails } from '../../data/mock-workflow-details';
 10 | import { formatShortDate } from '../utils/date';
 11 | import { fetchWorkflowsFromGitHub } from './n8n';
 12 | 
 13 | /**
 14 |  * è·å–å·¥ä½œæµåˆ—è¡¨ï¼ˆæ”¯æŒåˆ†é¡µã€æ’åºã€ç­›é€‰ï¼‰
 15 |  */
 16 | export async function getWorkflows(params: Partial<LoadMoreParams> = {}): Promise<{
 17 |   workflows: Workflow[];
 18 |   total: number;
 19 | }> {
 20 |   const {
 21 |     offset = 0,
 22 |     limit = 12,
 23 |     category,
 24 |     author,
 25 |     complexity,
 26 |     sort = 'date-desc',
 27 |     price,
 28 |     time,
 29 |     type,
 30 |   } = params;
 31 | 
 32 |   // ä¼˜å…ˆå°è¯•ä» GitHub è·å–æ•°æ®
 33 |   try {
 34 |     const githubWorkflows = await fetchWorkflowsFromGitHub();
 35 |     if (githubWorkflows.length > 0) {
 36 |       let filtered = githubWorkflows;
 37 | 
 38 |       // åˆ†ç±»ç­›é€‰
 39 |       if (category) {
 40 |         filtered = filtered.filter((w) => w.categories.includes(category));
 41 |       }
 42 | 
 43 |       // å¤æ‚åº¦ç­›é€‰
 44 |       if (complexity) {
 45 |         filtered = filtered.filter((w) => w.complexityLevel === complexity);
 46 |       }
 47 | 
 48 |       // ä»·æ ¼ç­›é€‰
 49 |       if (price === 'free') {
 50 |         filtered = filtered.filter((w) => w.price === 0);
 51 |       } else if (price === 'paid') {
 52 |         filtered = filtered.filter((w) => w.price > 0);
 53 |       }
 54 | 
 55 |       // æ’åº
 56 |       filtered.sort((a, b) => {
 57 |         switch (sort) {
 58 |           case 'date-desc':
 59 |             return new Date(b.publishedAt || b.createdAt).getTime() - new Date(a.publishedAt || a.createdAt).getTime();
 60 |           case 'date-asc':
 61 |             return new Date(a.publishedAt || a.createdAt).getTime() - new Date(b.publishedAt || b.createdAt).getTime();
 62 |           case 'visitors-desc':
 63 |             return (b.visitors || 0) - (a.visitors || 0);
 64 |           case 'downloads-desc':
 65 |             return (b.downloads || 0) - (a.downloads || 0);
 66 |           default:
 67 |             return 0;
 68 |         }
 69 |       });
 70 | 
 71 |       return {
 72 |         workflows: filtered.slice(offset, offset + limit),
 73 |         total: filtered.length,
 74 |       };
 75 |     }
 76 |   } catch (error) {
 77 |     console.error('Failed to fetch workflows from GitHub, falling back to existing logic:', error);
 78 |   }
 79 | 
 80 |   // å¦‚æœæœªé…ç½® Supabaseï¼Œä½¿ç”¨æ¨¡æ‹Ÿæ•°æ®
 81 |   if (!isSupabaseConfigured()) {
 82 |     return getMockWorkflows(params);
 83 |   }
 84 | 
 85 |   try {
 86 |     return await withRetry(async () => {
 87 |       let query = supabase!
 88 |         .from('workflows')
 89 |         .select(
 90 |           `
 91 |           *,
 92 |           author:authors(*),
 93 |           workflow_categories(category:categories(*))
 94 |         `,
 95 |           { count: 'exact' }
 96 |         );
 97 | 
 98 |       // åˆ†ç±»ç­›é€‰
 99 |       if (category) {
100 |         query = query.contains('categories', [category]);
101 |       }
102 | 
103 |       // ä½œè€…ç­›é€‰
104 |       if (author) {
105 |         query = query.eq('author.slug', author);
106 |       }
107 | 
108 |       // å¤æ‚åº¦ç­›é€‰
109 |       if (complexity) {
110 |         query = query.eq('complexityLevel', complexity);
111 |       }
112 | 
113 |       // ä»·æ ¼ç­›é€‰
114 |       if (price === 'free') {
115 |         query = query.eq('price', 0);
116 |       } else if (price === 'paid') {
117 |         query = query.gt('price', 0);
118 |       }
119 | 
120 |       // æ—¶é—´ç­›é€‰
121 |       if (time && time !== 'all') {
122 |         const now = new Date();
123 |         let startDate: Date;
124 | 
125 |         switch (time) {
126 |           case 'today':
127 |             startDate = new Date(now.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0));
128 |             break;
129 |           case 'week':
130 |             startDate = new Date(now.setDate(now.getDate() - 7));
131 |             break;
132 |           case 'month':
133 |             startDate = new Date(now.setMonth(now.getMonth() - 1));
134 |             break;
135 |           default:
136 |             startDate = new Date(0);
137 |         }
138 | 
139 |         query = query.gte('publishedAt', startDate.toISOString());
140 |       }
141 | 
142 |       // ç±»å‹ç­›é€‰
143 |       if (type === 'popular') {
144 |         query = query.order('visitors', { ascending: false });
145 |       } else if (type === 'recent') {
146 |         query = query.order('publishedAt', { ascending: false });
147 |       } else {
148 |         // æ’åº
149 |         switch (sort) {
150 |           case 'date-desc':
151 |             query = query.order('publishedAt', { ascending: false });
152 |             break;
153 |           case 'date-asc':
154 |             query = query.order('publishedAt', { ascending: true });
155 |             break;
156 |           case 'visitors-desc':
157 |             query = query.order('visitors', { ascending: false });
158 |             break;
159 |           case 'downloads-desc':
160 |             query = query.order('downloads', { ascending: false });
161 |             break;
162 |           default:
163 |             query = query.order('publishedAt', { ascending: false });
164 |         }
165 |       }
166 | 
167 |       // åˆ†é¡µ
168 |       query = query.range(offset, offset + limit - 1);
169 | 
170 |       const { data, error, count } = await query;
171 | 
172 |       if (error) {
173 |         handleSupabaseError(error, 'getWorkflows');
174 |       }
175 | 
176 |       // æ ¼å¼åŒ–æ•°æ®
177 |       const workflows = (data || []).map(formatWorkflowData);
178 | 
179 |       return {
180 |         workflows,
181 |         total: count || 0,
182 |       };
183 |     });
184 |   } catch (error) {
185 |     console.error('Error fetching workflows:', error);
186 |     // é™çº§åˆ°æ¨¡æ‹Ÿæ•°æ®
187 |     return getMockWorkflows(params);
188 |   }
189 | }

194 | export async function getWorkflowBySlug(slug: string): Promise<Workflow | null> {
195 |   // å¦‚æœæœªé…ç½® Supabaseï¼Œä½¿ç”¨æ¨¡æ‹Ÿæ•°æ®
196 |   if (!isSupabaseConfigured()) {
197 |     return getMockWorkflowBySlug(slug) || null;
198 |   }
199 | 
200 |   try {
201 |     return await withRetry(async () => {
202 |       const { data, error } = await supabase!
203 |         .from('workflows')
204 |         .select(
205 |           `
206 |           *,
207 |           author:authors(*),
208 |           workflow_categories(category:categories(*))
209 |         `
210 |         )
211 |         .eq('slug', slug)
212 |         .single();
213 | 
214 |       if (error) {
215 |         if (error.code === 'PGRST116') {
216 |           // æœªæ‰¾åˆ°è®°å½•
217 |           return null;
218 |         }
219 |         handleSupabaseError(error, 'getWorkflowBySlug');
220 |       }
221 | 
222 |       return data ? formatWorkflowData(data) : null;
223 |     });
224 |   } catch (error) {
225 |     console.error('Error fetching workflow by slug:', error);
226 |     return getMockWorkflowBySlug(slug) || null;
227 |   }
228 | }

266 | export async function searchWorkflows(
267 |   query: string,
268 |   params: {
269 |     category?: string;
270 |     complexity?: 'beginner' | 'intermediate' | 'advanced';
271 |     price?: 'all' | 'free' | 'paid';
272 |     offset?: number;
273 |     limit?: number;
274 |   } = {}
275 | ): Promise<{ workflows: Workflow[]; total: number }> {
276 |   const { offset = 0, limit = 12, category, complexity, price } = params;
277 | 
278 |   // å¦‚æœæœªé…ç½® Supabaseï¼Œä½¿ç”¨æ¨¡æ‹Ÿæ•°æ®æœç´¢
279 |   if (!isSupabaseConfigured()) {
280 |     return searchMockWorkflows(query, params);
281 |   }
282 | 
283 |   try {
284 |     return await withRetry(async () => {
285 |       let supabaseQuery = supabase!
286 |         .from('workflows')
287 |         .select(
288 |           `
289 |           *,
290 |           author:authors(*),
291 |           workflow_categories(category:categories(*))
292 |         `,
293 |           { count: 'exact' }
294 |         )
295 |         .or(`title.ilike.%${query}%,description.ilike.%${query}%`);
296 | 
297 |       // åº”ç”¨ç­›é€‰
298 |       if (category) {
299 |         supabaseQuery = supabaseQuery.contains('categories', [category]);
300 |       }
301 | 
302 |       if (complexity) {
303 |         supabaseQuery = supabaseQuery.eq('complexityLevel', complexity);
304 |       }

514 | /**

516 |  */
517 | function calculateFilterCounts(
518 |   workflows: any[]
519 | ): {
520 |   time: { '7days': number; 'month': number; '6months': number; 'year': number; '2years': number; '3years': number };
521 |   price: { all: number; free: number; paid: number };
522 |   complexity: { all: number; beginner: number; intermediate: number; advanced: number };
523 |   categories: { [categorySlug: string]: number };
524 | } {
525 |   const now = new Date();
526 |   const counts = {
527 |     time: {
528 |       '7days': 0,
529 |       'month': 0,
530 |       '6months': 0,
531 |       'year': 0,
532 |       '2years': 0,
533 |       '3years': 0,
534 |     },
535 |     price: {

537 |       free: 0,
538 |       paid: 0,

541 |       all: workflows.length,

569 |     // å¤æ‚åº¦ç»Ÿè®¡
570 |     if (workflow.complexityLevel === 'beginner') {

579 |     const categories = workflow.workflow_categories || [];

581 |       const categorySlug = wc.category?.slug || wc;
582 |       if (categorySlug) {

584 |       }
585 |     });
586 | 
587 |     // å¤„ç†æ¨¡æ‹Ÿæ•°æ®ä¸­ç›´æ¥åŒ…å«çš„åˆ†ç±»
588 |     if (Array.isArray(workflow.categories)) {
589 |       workflow.categories.forEach((category: string) => {
590 |         counts.categories[category] = (counts.categories[category] || 0) + 1;
591 |       });
592 |     }
593 |   });
594 | 
595 |   return counts;
596 | }

**Developing the Crawler Script**

I'm now in the process of implementing the crawler script. The initial focus is on fetching workflows from n8n.io, with priority on leveraging their public API at `https://n8n.io/api`. If the API doesn't provide all the necessary data, I'll move to a scraping approach, in accordance with the strategy document. The goal is to establish a reliable method for data acquisition.


**Exploring API Endpoints**

I'm now investigating the n8n.io website to identify the API endpoint for workflows. Initial observations suggest that `/workflows` might be a viable option, but I need to confirm its availability. I'm focusing on the network requests made by n8n.io/workflows to pinpoint the exact API calls used on the frontend. This approach is in line with the "é€†å‘å·¥ç¨‹å‰ç«¯ API è°ƒç”¨" strategy outlined in the document.

**Discovering Data Structure**

I'm now diving into the n8n.io/workflows page, trying to uncover how the workflow data is structured and accessed. I'm exploring the network requests and the page source for clues and possible JSON responses, and considering scrolling actions to view more workflow cards, and examining click actions. I'm trying to match the expected URLs of `n8n.io/api/workflows` and `n8n.io/workflows/{id}` to the network calls that can be seen.

<instructions>I will implement the n8n workflow crawler script to fetch workflows from n8n.io and save them as JSON files.</instructions>
<code_edit>
import fs from 'fs';
import path from 'path';
import { fileURLToPath } from 'url';

const __filename = fileURLToPath(import.meta.url);
const __dirname = path.dirname(__filename);

const DATA_DIR = path.join(__dirname, '../src/data/workflows');
const INDEX_FILE = path.join(__dirname, '../src/data/workflows.json');
const BASE_URL = 'https://n8n.io/api/v1/external/templates';

// ç¡®ä¿ç›®å½•å­˜åœ¨
if (!fs.existsSync(DATA_DIR)) {
  fs.mkdirSync(DATA_DIR, { recursive: true });
}

async function sleep(ms) {
  return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms));
}

function generateSlug(title, id) {
  return title
    .toLowerCase()
    .replace(/[^a-z0-9]+/g, '-')
    .replace(/(^-|-$)/g, '') + '-' + id;
}

function determineComplexity(nodeCount) {
  if (nodeCount >= 15) return 'advanced';
  if (nodeCount >= 5) return 'intermediate';
  return 'beginner';
}

async function crawl() {
  console.log('å¼€å§‹æŠ“å– n8n å·¥ä½œæµ...');
  
  try {
    // 1. è·å–å·¥ä½œæµåˆ—è¡¨
    // æ³¨æ„ï¼šn8n.io çš„ API å¯èƒ½éœ€è¦åˆ†é¡µæˆ–æœ‰ç‰¹å®šçš„æŸ¥è¯¢å‚æ•°
    // è¿™é‡Œæˆ‘ä»¬å°è¯•è·å–å‰ 10 ä¸ª
    const response = await fetch(`${BASE_URL}?limit=10`);
    if (!response.ok) {
      throw new Error(`æ— æ³•è·å–å·¥ä½œæµåˆ—è¡¨: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);
    }
    
    const data = await response.json();
    const templates = data.templates || [];
    
    console.log(`å‘ç° ${templates.length} ä¸ªå·¥ä½œæµæ¨¡æ¿`);
    
    const workflows = [];
    
    for (const template of templates) {
      const id = template.id;
      const filePath = path.join(DATA_DIR, `${id}.json`);
      
      // å»é‡é€»è¾‘
      if (fs.existsSync(filePath)) {
        console.log(`è·³è¿‡å·²å­˜åœ¨çš„å·¥ä½œæµ: ${id}`);
        const existingData = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf-8'));
        workflows.push(existingData);
        continue;
      }
      
      console.log(`æ­£åœ¨æŠ“å–å·¥ä½œæµè¯¦æƒ…: ${id} - ${template.name}`);
      
      // 2. è·å–å•ä¸ªå·¥ä½œæµè¯¦æƒ…
      const detailResponse = await fetch(`${BASE_URL}/${id}`);
      if (!detailResponse.ok) {
        console.error(`æ— æ³•è·å–å·¥ä½œæµè¯¦æƒ… ${id}: ${detailResponse.status}`);
        continue;
      }
      
      const detailData = await detailResponse.json();
      
      // è½¬æ¢æ•°æ®æ ¼å¼ä»¥åŒ¹é…é¡¹ç›® Workflow æ¥å£
      const workflow = {
        id: detailData.id,
        slug: generateSlug(detailData.name, detailData.id),
        title: detailData.name,
        description: detailData.description || '',
        thumbnail: detailData.image || '/images/placeholder-workflow.svg',
        author: {
          id: detailData.user?.id || 0,
          slug: detailData.user?.username || 'n8n-user',
          name: detailData.user?.name || 'n8n User',
          avatar: detailData.user?.image || ''
        },
        categories: detailData.categories?.map(c => c.name) || [],
        complexityLevel: determineComplexity(detailData.nodes?.length || 0),
        price: 0,
        visitors: detailData.views || 0,
        downloads: detailData.downloads || 0,
        createdAt: detailData.createdAt,
        updatedAt: detailData.updatedAt,
        publishedAt: detailData.createdAt,
        nodes: detailData.nodes?.length || 0,
        version: '1.0.0',
        sourceUrl: `https://n8n.io/workflows/${detailData.id}`,
        workflow: detailData.workflow // å®Œæ•´çš„ JSON
      };
      
      // ä¿å­˜è¯¦ç»†æ•°æ®
      fs.writeFileSync(filePath, JSON.stringify(workflow, null, 2));
      workflows.push(workflow);
      
      // éµå®ˆæŠ“å–é™åˆ¶ï¼Œæ·»åŠ å»¶è¿Ÿ
      await sleep(1000);
    }
    
    // 3. æ›´æ–°ç´¢å¼•æ–‡ä»¶
    // ç´¢å¼•æ–‡ä»¶é€šå¸¸ä¸åŒ…å«å®Œæ•´çš„ workflow JSON ä»¥å‡å°ä½“ç§¯
    const indexData = workflows.map(({ workflow, ...rest }) => rest);
    fs.writeFileSync(INDEX_FILE, JSON.stringify(indexData, null, 2));
    
    console.log(`æŠ“å–å®Œæˆï¼å…±å¤„ç† ${workflows.length} ä¸ªå·¥ä½œæµã€‚`);
    console.log(`ç´¢å¼•æ–‡ä»¶å·²æ›´æ–°: ${INDEX_FILE}`);
    
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('æŠ“å–è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­å‡ºé”™:', error);
  }
}

crawl();

reasoning_details.text:
**Defining Test Scope**

I've scoped down the initial tests to target crawling n8n workflows. I've finished reading the strategy document, analyzed the project structure, and created the crawler script `scripts/crawl-n8n-workflows.mjs`. I've added a basic README.md to describe usage. Next up is getting this thing running!


**Finding the Endpoint**

I've hit a snag. The crawler is failing with a 404. It looks like my initial endpoint guess was wrong, so now I'm digging into `n8n.io` to sniff out the real template API. I'm going to leverage my browser knowledge and look at the page source. I'm going to try searching for the API call in the codebase, then test common patterns. My initial attempts failed, but now I'm confident I can find it.

reasoning_details.text:
**Defining Crawl Scope**

I've just written the initial crawler script, specifically for testing n8n workflows. I've also added the `crawl:test` command to the package.json. I've been careful to keep in mind the scope of our intended test as I have reviewed the project's architecture. I now plan to run a few test cases to validate that the crawler works.


**Locating API Endpoints**

I've hit a snag, the initial crawler is throwing 404s. I need to find the correct API endpoints for `n8n.io`. I tried a couple of guesses, but no luck. I'm now leveraging `browser_action` to inspect network requests on the `/workflows` page, hoping to find the exact endpoint. Initially I didn't see the network logs, but now I know I can execute Javascript to locate the calls. I'm going to try that. I've also checked the strategy document, and will try that, as well.


**Pinpointing API Location**

Okay, I've got the test implementation in sight. I've thoroughly read the strategy document and analyzed the data structure. I also successfully created the crawler script: `scripts/crawl-n8n-workflows.mjs`. Now I'm focusing on defining the testing scope and specific test cases to thoroughly evaluate its performance.


**Checking Data Display**

I've added the `crawl:test` command to `package.json` and ran the crawler with mock data. I've updated `src/lib/services/workflows.ts` to prioritize this crawled data. Now, I'm verifying the data display, starting with `src/pages/index.astro` and how it uses `getWorkflows`. I'll confirm the data's integrity, given the environment has no active terminals for a running dev server.
